title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Germany is efficiently using its resources and/or does not explain that it is producing at a point on its production possibilities curve.
The response states that Germany is efficiently using its resources and explains that it is producing at a point on its production possibilities curve.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Poland has the comparative advantage in the production of lumber and/or does not explain that Poland has the lower opportunity cost in producing lumber: the opportunity cost of producing one unit of lumber in Poland is 0.1 unit of potatoes and in Germany it is 0.3 unit of potatoes.

The response states that Poland has the comparative advantage in the production of lumber and explains that Poland has the lower opportunity cost in producing lumber: the opportunity cost of producing one unit of lumber in Poland is 0.1 unit of potatoes and in Germany it is 0.3 unit of potatoes.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that yes, these terms of trade are mutually beneficial and/or does not explain that these terms of trade fall between the two countries’ opportunity costs (i.e., between 3.33 and 10 units of lumber).

The response states that yes, these terms of trade are mutually beneficial and explains that these terms of trade fall between the two countries’ opportunity costs (i.e., between 3.33 and 10 units of lumber).

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Poland’s opportunity cost of producing lumber will increase and/or does not explain that it will have to give up more units of potatoes to produce each unit of lumber.
The response states that Poland’s opportunity cost of producing lumber will increase and explains that it will have to give up more units of potatoes to produce each unit of lumber.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the number of employed people in Germany as 76 million and/or does not show the work.
